00028 #include "qf_pkg.h"
00029 #include "qassert.h"
00030 
00031 Q_DEFINE_THIS_MODULE(qf_pspub)
00032 
00033 
00039 /*..........................................................................*/
00040 void QF_publish(QEvent const *e) {
00041     QF_INT_LOCK_KEY_
00042 
00043       /* make sure that the published signal is within the configured range */
00044     Q_REQUIRE(e->sig < QF_maxSignal_);
00045 
00046     QF_INT_LOCK_();
00047 
00048     QS_BEGIN_NOLOCK_(QS_QF_PUBLISH, (void *)0, (void *)0)
00049         QS_TIME_();                                        /* the timestamp */
00050         QS_SIG_(e->sig);                         /* the signal of the event */
00051         QS_U8_(e->dynamic_);         /* the dynamic attributes of the event */
00052     QS_END_NOLOCK_()
00053 
00054     if (e->dynamic_ != (uint8_t)0) {              /* is it a dynamic event? */
00055         /*lint -e1773                            Attempt to cast away const */
00056         ++((QEvent *)e)->dynamic_;   /* increment reference counter, NOTE01 */
00057                 /* NOTE: cast the 'const' away, which is legitimate because */
00058                 /* it's a dynamic event */
00059     }
00060     QF_INT_UNLOCK_();
00061 
00062 #if (QF_MAX_ACTIVE <= 8)
00063     {
00064         uint8_t tmp = QF_subscrList_[e->sig].bits[0];
00065         while (tmp != (uint8_t)0) {
00066             uint8_t p = Q_ROM_BYTE(QF_log2Lkup[tmp]);
00067             tmp &= Q_ROM_BYTE(QF_invPwr2Lkup[p]);   /* clear subscriber bit */
00068             Q_ASSERT(QF_active_[p] != (QActive *)0);  /* must be registered */
00069 
00070                                /* internally asserts if the queue overflows */
00071             QActive_postFIFO(QF_active_[p], e);
00072         }
00073     }
00074 #else
00075     {
00076         uint8_t i = Q_DIM(QF_subscrList_[0].bits);
00077         do {               /* go through all bytes in the subscription list */
00078             uint8_t tmp;
00079             --i;
00080             tmp = QF_subscrList_[e->sig].bits[i];
00081             while (tmp != (uint8_t)0) {
00082                 uint8_t p = Q_ROM_BYTE(QF_log2Lkup[tmp]);
00083                 tmp &= Q_ROM_BYTE(QF_invPwr2Lkup[p]);/*clear subscriber bit */
00084                 p = (uint8_t)(p + (i << 3));         /* adjust the priority */
00085                 Q_ASSERT(QF_active_[p] != (QActive *)0);/*must be registered*/
00086 
00087                                /* internally asserts if the queue overflows */
00088                 QActive_postFIFO(QF_active_[p], e);
00089             }
00090         } while (i != (uint8_t)0);
00091     }
00092 #endif
00093 
00094     QF_gc(e);                      /* run the garbage collector, see NOTE01 */
00095 }
00096 
00097 /*****************************************************************************
00098 * NOTE01:
00099 * QF_publish() increments the reference counter to prevent premature
00100 * recycling of the event while the multicasting is still in progress.
00101 * At the end of the function, the garbage collector step decrements the
00102 * reference counter and recycles the event if the counter drops to zero.
00103 * This covers the case when the event was published without any subscribers.
00104 */
